intro: Hypodematium truncatum, commonly known as the rough hypodematium, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Hypodematium truncatum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
